home.title: Vector, not chaos
home.subtitle: Telosynergism is a meaning framework that connects human energy, social trust, technological noise, and nature’s sustainability.

heroCard.title: What we do
heroCard.body: We define 4 contours and observe their coherence via SVI/IT. We provide protocols for restoring resonance and reducing entropy.
heroCard.callout: This is a demo intended for navigation and collaborative design.

problems.title: Decision entropy
problems.description: More activity does not guarantee direction: KPIs rise while meaning fades.

problems.title: Contour gaps
problems.description: Energy, trust, noise, and sustainability drift apart—resonance breaks.

problems.title: Technological noise
problems.description: Excess complexity and opacity undermine coherence.

meaning.title: Meaning = infrastructure
meaning.body: We treat meaning as system infrastructure, not an abstract slogan. Meaning sets the vector; protocols sustain movement.

svi.title: SVI & IT
svi.body: SVI is a seven-component stability profile. IT is an index of coherence and resonance. Together they form an observable compass.

manifestMini.title: Mini-manifesto
manifestMini.lines:
We choose direction, not only speed.
We measure coherence, not only volume.
We design resonance, not just growth.
We reduce noise to hear meaning.
We work with systems, not fragments.
We keep ethics and transparency.
We make complexity accessible.
We build meaning infrastructure.

twoMin.title: Telosynergism Catechism
twoMin.subtitle: A short handbook of the meaning-vector civilization: definitions, principles, differences, and how to start practicing.

blocks.title: 1. What is Telosynergism?
blocks.body: Telosynergism is a direction-centered ideology of meaning. It teaches you to live so that your actions amplify your telos—your inner meaning vector—and resonate with people, technology, and nature. The world is stronger when its parts move in the same meaning direction.

blocks.title: 2. What is telos?
blocks.body: Telos is your highest purpose—your meaning vector. Not a wish, not a dream, not a mood, but a direction you are meant to grow into. Telos exists for a person, a family, a city, a country, and humanity.

blocks.title: 3. What is synergy?
blocks.body: Synergy is when 1+1 > 2. In Telosynergism it means: when people, society, technology, and nature move in one direction, their forces multiply.

blocks.title: 4. What is the core idea?
blocks.body: The core idea is that meaning is infrastructure—like roads, electricity, or the internet. Meaning can be directed, amplified, measured, and used to build systems around it.

blocks.title: 5. How is it different from socialism and capitalism?
blocks.body: Socialism: the goal is equality, the center is public ownership. Capitalism: the goal is profit, the center is private ownership. Telosynergism: the goal is amplification of the meaning vector, the center is meaning as a public good.

blocks.title: 6. Why does a person need telos?
blocks.body: Without telos a person sinks into chaos, loses energy, walks in circles, becomes dependent on external forces, and is easy to manipulate. With telos, a person holds direction, keeps focus, grows rather than drifts, creates value, and lives consciously.

blocks.title: 7. How do you find your telos?
blocks.body: Telos appears where three circles intersect: strength (what you can truly do), passion (what energizes you), and the world’s need (what people/nature/society genuinely require).

blocks.title: 8. What is a meaning vector?
blocks.body: It is the direction of your development, behavior, decisions, and capabilities. A vector can be measured: where you are actually going, not where you say you want to go.

blocks.title: 9. What destroys telos?
blocks.body: Three forces: meaning entropy (noise, chaos, meaninglessness), the vector gap (your lifestyle contradicts your highest purpose), and external noise (toxic technologies, manipulation, dependency).

blocks.title: 10. What strengthens telos?
blocks.body: Three supports: focus (holding direction), practice (daily actions that amplify the vector), and environment (a context that supports your telos).

blocks.title: 11. What is the resonance of four contours?
blocks.body: Civilization consists of four contours: human, society, technology, nature. When their vectors align, the world strengthens. When they fragment, chaos follows.

blocks.title: 12. What does Telosynergism require from the state?
blocks.body: The state should be an architect of direction: align vectors of people, technology, and nature, protect them from разрушение, and design the future on a 50–100 year horizon.

blocks.title: 13. What does it require from technology?
blocks.body: Technology must serve telos, not destroy it. Addictive algorithms and manipulation systems are unacceptable. Supported: telos-oriented AI assistants, health/education/development systems, and technologies that amplify the human.

blocks.title: 14. What is the Telos-Synergy Index (IT)?
blocks.body: IT is the main indicator of directionality. It shows whether contour vectors align, whether they amplify each other, where a system is going, what is breaking, and what is growing. In the future, countries will compete by IT the way they compete by GDP today.

blocks.title: 15. What does Telosynergism require from the individual?
blocks.body: Three commitments: awareness (know your vector and control attention), creativeness (act to amplify your future), and contour responsibility (consider people, technology, and nature).

blocks.title: 16. Who is a Telosynergism person?
blocks.body: Not a consumer. Not a cog. Not a crowd unit. A carrier of a meaning vector that leads through chaos into the future.

blocks.title: 17. The ultimate goal
blocks.body: To build a civilization where meaning is the foundation; the human is unfolded; technology amplifies; nature regenerates; the future attracts rather than frightens.

blocks.title: 18. How to start right now
blocks.body: 1) Define your telos. 2) Drop actions that pull you away. 3) Create daily meaning-amplifying practices. 4) Build a resonant environment. 5) Influence softly—by example. 6) Don’t quit: telos grows through practice.

blocks.title: 19. “Vector, not chaos”
blocks.body: The key principle: live not by reactions. Live by direction.

blocks.title: 20. Telos in one sentence
blocks.body: Telos is what you become yourself for.

twoMin.closing: If you want to move from meaning to observability: start with the SVI test, then open the resonance simulator.

manifest.title: The Telosynergism Manifesto
manifest.subtitle: We build a system where meaning, observability, and ethics are connected.

principles.title: Principles
items: Meaning sets the vector; metrics support movement.
Resonance matters more than chaotic growth.
Noise reduction is a foundational practice.
The system matters more than local wins.

not.title: What this is not
items: Not a religion or an exclusion ideology.
Not anti-technology—rather, working with its noise.

model.title: The 4 contours of Telosynergism
model.subtitle: Contours are measurable fields that must be coherent.

E.title: E — human energy
E.body: Focus, motivation, capacity to hold meaning.

D.title: D — social trust
D.body: Transparency, reliability of relationships and institutions.

antipatterns.title: Anti-patterns
items: Growth at the cost of burnout.

sviTest.title: SVI test
sviTest.disclaimer: SVI is a demo tool, not psychological diagnostics.

questions.T: I understand the direction and can explain it to others.
questions.A: I can influence decisions and practices.
questions.E: I have a stable resource of energy and attention.
questions.R: There is trust and connectedness between participants.
questions.S: The tech environment is clear and not overloaded.
questions.H: We plan beyond the next quarter.

interpretations.person: Personal volume can rise, but without direction IT falls.
interpretations.team: A team becomes stable only when contours are synchronized.
interpretations.city: City scale requires noise reduction—otherwise coordination breaks.

practice.title: Telosynergism protocols
practice.subtitle: Three practical modes that restore resonance.

A.title: Protocol A — Navigation
A.body: Clarify direction, align roles, and focus on trajectory.

B.title: Protocol B — Recovery
B.body: Reduce noise and restore energy through rhythms and pauses.

C.title: Protocol C — Redesign
C.body: Reassemble contours for resonance and a long horizon.

trajectory.title: Trajectory Simulator
trajectory.subtitle: Choose a scenario and view the trajectory.

kpi-any-cost.title: Maximize KPI at any cost
kpi-any-cost.description: Sharp KPI rise with declining stability.
kpi-any-cost.summary: Short-term growth is achieved at the cost of burnout and falling IT.

restore-energy.title: Reduce noise and restore energy
restore-energy.summary: A short-term slowdown supports sustained IT growth.

redesign-resonance.title: Redesign for contour resonance
redesign-resonance.description: System redesign for a long trajectory.

applications.title: Applications
applications.subtitle: One template: problem → gap → protocol → metrics → example.

team.title: Team
team.example: Update communication rules and reduce noise.

items.a: It is a research framework and a practical prototype.

items.q: Can these metrics be used to evaluate people?
items.a: No. The metrics are not intended to judge individuals.
It is the minimal set of fields that creates resonance.
An index of contour coherence and noise reduction.

items.q: How fast can you see results?
items.a: It depends on system scale, but typically 2–6 weeks for first shifts.
They are presented on the Practice page.

items.q: Can this be used in business?
items.a: Yes, but only with ethics and transparency.
For now, this is an open public prototype.

items.q: Can this be embedded into a product?
items.a: Yes—this is why protocols and metrics are being developed.

telos.definition: Direction and meaning that keeps a system coherent.

entropy.definition: Level of chaos and loss of direction.
